description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

The YouTube Video Infrastructure team is the backbone of the video platform, leading innovations in audio/video quality, video processing, content delivery, and player features across Google. Our work brings to life innovative new features and improved experiences for our users at a global scale (e.g. 4K, VR, HFR, HDR), and power top YouTube initiatives including Music, Gaming, Live, and YouTube TV. We manage challenges that include how to scale our infrastructure to the continued massive growth of YouTube traffic, leading industry-wide initiatives in next generation codec/compression technology, identifying customized improvements to the watch experience for lower-bandwidth emerging markets, and optimizing the capabilities of the core player to directly improve the user viewing experience (such as lower rebuffers, higher quality, and quicker start times).

As a Video Infrastructure Technical Program Manager, you define, organize, and lead priority engineering initiatives that involve close collaboration within the Video Infrastructure Engineering organization, and across other Google Engineering teams and product areas.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience motivating teams.
  • 5 years of program management experience managing projects involving multiple teams/stakeholders, resource planning and budgeting/forecasting.
  • Experience with project management tools, methodology, and Google Docs.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in a technical field.
  • Domain expertise in video technology and/or experience working with video processing/content delivery/player technologies.
  • Ability to find creative solutions to complex situations.
  • Ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, multi-task, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems across cross-functional teams.
  • Articulate communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills and the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
responsibilities:
• Lead video infrastructure key initiatives; identify and investigate issues, define success metrics, develop project plans and roadmaps, prioritize resources, and create and implement process to drive landings.
  • Identify and prioritize team needs and implement processes, tools, communications to deliver quality, timely results.
  • Provide project management for engineering and product efforts, cross-team integrations, notes, action items, product launches.
  • Apply technical judgment to efficiently make progress, resolve problems on technical issues with your teams, and determine, gather, and analyze metrics around our systems.
  • Provide clear communication to YouTube Leadership regarding project status, resource requirements, issues, and priorities.
title: Technical Program Manager, Video Infrastructure, YouTube
